title: Impedance
fullText:
The earthing system impedance and characteristics of protective devices shall be such that, if a fault of negligible impedance occurs anywhere in the electrical installation between an active conductor and an exposed conductive part or protective earthing conductor, automatic disconnection of the supply will occur within the specified time.

NOTES:
1.	Additional earthing requirements apply in patient areas of hospitals, medical and dental practices, and dialyzing locations. Refer to AS/NZS 3003.
2.	The return path will comprise both protective earthing and neutral conductors.
3.	Appendix B illustrates a method of complying with the requirements of this Clause based on the determination of the maximum length of a circuit in relation to the size of circuit conductors and type of protective device.
4.	Guidance on the measurement of the earth fault-loop impedance of each circuit is given in Appendix B.
